images.copyright: Charles Bridge over the Vltava River in Prague (© Martin Moxter/Offset)
images.title: Cross this bridge if you dare
images.caption: Cross this bridge if you dare
images.desc: Superstition abounds on Prague’s Charles Bridge, dating back to its construction in 1357. Builders laid the original bridge stone on July 9 at exactly 5:31 AM, coinciding with a precise set of numbers - the palindrome 135797531 - which was believed to bring additional strength to the structure. But the superstition didn’t stop there. The bridge was also constructed in perfect alignment with the tomb of St. Vitus and the setting sun on the equinox. A more recent superstition involves the statue of the revered Saint John of Nepomuk that stands on the bridge.
images.bsTitle: Cross this bridge if you dare
